Regime_B2C: As an overseas department of France, French Guiana follows French and EU telemarketing laws. Telemarketing to consumers is tightly regulated under the French Consumer Code and GDPR. opt_in_or_out_B2B: Opt-out (No blanket prohibition on B2B telemarketing; must honor any objections or corporate TPS if applicable).

DNC_Check_Required_for_ER(Y/N/Depends): No (If an existing customer relationship exists, calls are allowed even if the number is on Bloctel – e.g., ongoing contract).
Quiet_Hours(allowed_window_local): Yes – only Mon–Fri 10:00–13:00 and 14:00–20:00; no calls on weekends or holidays (France decree as of March 2023).
AIDisclosure_Required(Y/N/Depends): Yes/Depends (Automated/prerecorded calls require prior express consent and must state the caller's identity. No specific rule for a live agent using AI voice, but fully automated calls are treated as robocalls requiring consent.)

Notes_for_Product: Full French compliance: must integrate Bloctel scrubbing before dialing any French Guiana numbers. Only call within permitted hours. Configure caller ID to an approved range. Regime_B2C: U.S. telemarketing laws apply in Guam (a U.S. territory). The FTC/FCC rules under the Telephone Consumer Protection Act and Telemarketing Sales Rule govern calls. Consumers are protected by the National Do Not Call Registry and TCPA regulations (e.g., no calls outside 8am–9pm, consent for autodialed/prerecorded calls to cell phones).
opt_in_or_out_B2C: Opt-out (Consumers can register their numbers on the National DNC Registry to opt out. Otherwise, telemarketers may call, within legal hours, unless the consumer has directly opted out or is on the DNC.) Robocalls require prior express consent.
Regime_B2B: Business numbers are generally not covered by the National DNC rules (the U.S. list is for residential numbers). Telemarketing to businesses is allowed, aside from FCC anti-fraud/spam norms.
opt_in_or_out_B2B: Opt-out (No national list; individual businesses can ask to be placed on a company's do-not-call list, which must be honored).
DNC_Registry_Name: U.S. National Do Not Call Registry.
DNC_API_or_Bulk(Y/N/Unknown): Yes (telemarketers download bulk lists for scrubbing).
DNC_Check_Required_for_ER(Y/N/Depends): Depends (If an established business relationship exists, a company may call a DNC-listed consumer for up to 18 months since last purchase, or 3 months since an inquiry, unless the consumer asked to be put on the company's internal do-not-call list).
Quiet_Hours(allowed_window_local): Yes – no calls before 8:00 am or after 9:00 pm local time.
AIDisclosure_Required(Y/N/Depends): Yes (Prerecorded/artificial-voice calls require prior express consent and must include the identity of the caller and a toll-free opt-out mechanism in the message).
Recording_Basis(consent/legitimate_inter: Legitimate interest/One-party consent (U.S. federal law allows recording with one-party consent; Guam has no stricter law. Still, best practice is to announce, especially for marketing calls, to avoid UDAP issues).
Existing_Relationship_Exemption(plain_te: Yes, limited. An existing business relationship (customer within 18 months) allows exempt calls to a number on the DNC list. However, if the person asks the company not to call, that request overrides the exemption.
Known_Exceptions(notes): Exemptions: purely informational calls, political calls, surveys, and calls from charities are not covered by DNC rules. Also, calls to solicit charitable donations by third-party telemarketers, and informational calls, have slightly different rules but generally not covered by DNC.
CallerID/Prefix_Rules: Yes – telemarketers must transmit a valid caller ID number that isn't blocked. (No special prefix; however, Guam numbers use country code +1 like U.S.)
Recent_Changes(2024+): FCC/FTC are continuously updating rules to combat robocalls (e.g., STIR/SHAKEN implemented). In 2023, FTC amended the TSR to ban certain payment methods and tighten lead generation (effective 2024). These apply to Guam as a U.S. territory.
Primary_Sources(max3;official): 47 CFR §64.1200 (TCPA rules); FTC Q&A on DNC (established relationship and exemptions).
Notes_for_Product: Guam phone numbers are part of NANP, so include them in U.S. compliance processes. Always check scrubbed lists against the national DNC. Implement time-of-day call blocks outside 8am-9pm. Ensure your dialing system accounts for Guam's time zone. Obtain express written consent for any autodialed or prerecorded marketing calls (especially to mobile numbers).
